content.description:
5 meters left of 'Ferrata Direct'. Gullylike start to birch tree then trends right after cedar. Low angle start on thinner ice.Short screws should do the job for first 5-6 meters then it is possible to put rock gear.A nut ranging from 10-15mm and/or the equivalent of a Camalot #2 will protect you to the cedar(crux)where ice thickness and quality could be less than satisfying for screws.Enjoy a butt rest against the tree then follow where thick.
Sweet and commiting climbing.
Highly recommended if 'on'. Short to medium ice screws-rock pros(details above)-2 double shoulder length slings(in case you have to protect on birch and/or cedar.
Trees on top for rappelling.

First pitch can be of lesser quality ice or stiffer than the suggested WI4.Belay on rock protection or screws depending on ice formation.Then follow the crusty snow/ice ramp to the left.Second pitch is the candy.Go up the gully/diedral that can be thin or even shy of yellowish ice on certain years.If the second pitch in entirely filled with ice,a standard rack of screws will protect it.If dryer,bring a few shorties as well as a standard rack of cams/nuts.A Laurentian Classic! Find 'Le Centennaire' trail that is a few hundred feet north(just before the bridge)of parking with self registration.
Walk the trail up the mountain for about 10-15 minutes until you see an emergency evacuation trail on the left (white cross on a red sign with #1 written).If you look up the cliff,you will have a good visual of ramp and second pitch(steep gully/diedral) of 'La Noire'.
Walk this trail for 1 minute and look for an orange flag on your right side...that will indicate the final approach(15-20min)to the route.
If early in the season,chances are that you will be opening the trail(try following orange flags or instinctively make your way up to the base of the route. You will have to make the call from its base.

There are two trees equipped with rappel slings.
One at the top and one on the left halfway down.

Follow the thicker ice in the corner. Just on your left once you go up the ramp to the upper/right section. Ice Screws
Rap from trees on top, there's slings and rings, a single 70m rope reaches.

Find the start of the Via Ferrata (metal steps). Climb the obvious and very inviting ice line just above those steps. Continuous and straight forward with a spicier exit. The first few meters can be thin for screws but you can always(or not),clip a draw on one of the metal steps for protection.You can also put a yellow Alien or BD .4 if still thin at about 7-8 m then short to medium length screws will do. Fun climb!!! Cam and short to medium screws
Rap sling on tree

The first headwall looks more vertical than it is! Great stuff, second short wall and you're on top. The near vertical face right of the right facing corner and left of the ramp leading to the upper section. Ice screws.
Slings and rings on the trees, need 2 ropes to get down.

Some parts of this climb can be thin in certain conditions. head up the corner just right of the right facing rock corner, follow the corner into the gully to a ledge and finish off the last headwall. First climbable route with an obvious squeezed-in passage. Ice screws and a couple small rock pieces if the ice is thin.
Slings and rings on trees, need 2 ropes to get down.

This route is steep, you may need to bypass a thin portion around 6m up by the left (Gully) or right. 
 It's pretty straighforward, go straight, the upper section can seriously become overhanging as the ice keeps bulging at the top.

Once you've gotten up the the steep slope to the right side section
Screws, you can to a single 70m rope rap from the top of the route.

Thin ice covering a beautiful slab of rock. once you've reached the big ledge, you can make your way bushwhack style to the top of the left gully and face. the face on the left of the Ferrata and right of the corner. short screws and slings for the top.
rap off the tree on the top of the face

FOR THE MOMENT ICE CLIMBING IS FORBIDEN IN THE PARK, the FQME site comission is mandated to work out a solution to gain back acess. PLEASE don't go it will only make things worse._____ Very nice spot except for the Via Ferrata metal on the wall, still, worth the detour,  the climbs are located within the Mont Tremblant National Park

POUR LE MOMENT L'ESCALADE DE GLACE EST INTERDITE DANS LE PARC, la comission des sites de la FQME est mandatée pour trouver une solution pour regagné l'accès SVP n'y allez pas cela ne ferait que rendre les négos plus dificile._____ Belle cascade principale si ont ne regarde pas trop de chaque côté le métal de la Via Ferrata, malgré cela ça vaut le détour, les voies sont situées dans le Parc du Mont Tremblant.
